moves.1. d4: Arash starts with the queen's pawn opening.
moves.2. c4: Queens pawn gambit. A rather safe gambit, in my opinion.
moves.2... e6: I respond with the Queen's gambit declined. I'll also be honest with you here: I don't know anything about openings beyond this move. From here out I'm going with my best judgement.
moves.3. a3: My guess is he played this to prevent Bb4.
moves.3... Nf6: "Develop the least developed piece to the best possible square"
moves.4. Nc3: He develops his knight as well.
moves.5... Be7: I do this to castle, as well as defend against Bg5.
moves.6. Bf4: I'm pretty sure this is a good move...
moves.7... exd5: I was very happy to do this move because, until now, my LSB was completely trapped. I think the trade favored me...
moves.8. Be5: He's trying to invade, but I think this is pointless, and a wast of time. After I press the f pawn, not only will white's DSB be forced to die, but whites f6 knight won't be able to go to e5 or g5.
moves.9... Nxg3: And I trade an inactive knight for an active bishop.
moves.11... dxe4: I'm not sure if this is the best move...there's alot of variations here. Reguardless, this is what I went with. What do you think of it?
moves.12. Nxe4: Material is still equal... but when I look at this, white seems to have a bit of an advantage.
moves.12... Bg4: Trying to get the bishop involved.
moves.13. d5: Pressing the pawn, forcing me to move the knight.
moves.13... Ne5: I can't let it die, and this looks like a good square.
moves.14... Nxf3+: "When pieces make contact, it is generally not a good idea to trade off, but instead, build pressure on the pieces" ...yeah, I didn't do that. Probably shouldn't have traded...
moves.15. gxf3: He takes with the pawn, forcing me to move my bishop.
moves.15... Bf5: I don't like this square, but I didn't like most of the other squares either.
moves.16. Qb3: Attacking the b7 square, while indirectly attacking my king (Which I didn't see).
moves.16... Qc8: I go to defend the b7 square.
moves.17. d6+: And there it is. The move that killed me.
moves.18. Bc4: And the game ends here. Feel free to comment.
